page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY 7
page.content:
This era heralded the establishment of the brewing{industry}as a prosperous benefit to the area. After the construction of a brewery in Caergwrle's Derby Road, pubs such as the Derby Arms, Castle Inn, Crown Inn, Bridge Inn and Halfway Inn sprang up in Caergwrle and the Red Lion and White Lion in Hope.
In 1801, the first British census was undertaken. This revealed that in the Lordship (Parish) of Hope there were 1924 inhabitants. By the end of the century, the{population}had soared to over 3000. This was primarily the result of the Industrial Revolution and typified the general trend of population rise throughout the country. {(Local history)}
